name: darwinist

relating to or accepting the theories of Charles Darwin, which described how animals and plants change and develop over millions of years, with those that are best suited to their environment being the most successful and others that are less well suited not continuing to exist: Religious fundamentalists tried to remove Darwinist elements of the curriculum. The Darwinist philosopher puts religion on the same level as fairy tales. Synonym
Darwinian
More examplesFewer examplesThey incorporated Darwinist concepts of heredity into their thinking. There are fossils to support Darwinist theories.Infidelity is more about emotional immaturity and an ego boost than some kind of Darwinist legacy.

someone who accepts the theories of Charles Darwin, which described how animals and plants change and develop over millions of years, with those that are best suited to their environment being the most successful and others that are less well suited not continuing to exist: Darwinists believe that students should learn more about evolution. It does not take a Darwinist to work out that any competition has losers. Synonym
Darwinian
More examplesFewer examplesHe is possibly the greatest Darwinist since Darwin.Darwinists may speak of "the survival of the fittest."Being a true Darwinist requires more than just giving lip service to natural selection before going on to something else.
